title: TOEFL ITP Structure & Written Expression Test

questions.question: _____ of classical ballet in the United States began around 1830.
questions.explanation: Structure question 1 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Mason bees are solitary bees, which means _____ in colonies like honeybees or bumblebees.
options: B) when they do not live
C) that they do not live
questions.explanation: Structure question 2 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Long before the advent of written literature, _____ their myths and stories in oral poems told by successive generations.
questions.explanation: Structure question 3 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Comparative anatomy is _____ classification of both plants and animals.
questions.explanation: Structure question 4 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Although legend has it that the Pilgrims first set foot in America on Plymouth Rock in 1620, _____ documentary evidence confirming this.
questions.explanation: Structure question 5 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Despite its fishlike form, the whale is _____ and will drown if submerged too long.
options: A) an animal breathes air that
B) an animal that breathes air
D) that an animal breathes air
questions.explanation: Structure question 6 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Clouds _____ in warm air rises, cools, and condenses.
questions.explanation: Structure question 7 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Portland, _____, is located primarily on two hilly peninsulas overlooking Casco Bay and its many islands.
questions.explanation: Structure question 8 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Mars, the so-called red planet, is actually colored red by iron oxide and other impurities _____ the whole surface.
questions.explanation: Structure question 9 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: The 1903 film The Great Train Robbery was the first significant film in which the classic western story's formula of crime and retribution _____.
questions.explanation: Structure question 10 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: When played in certain ways, the bassoon can produce comical sounds, _____ it is sometimes referred to as the clown of the orchestra.
questions.explanation: Structure question 11 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: In modern societies, _____ authorized body such as a legislature or a court makes the law.
questions.explanation: Structure question 12 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: The sense of smell functions chemically, _____ the sense of taste, but it is 10,000 times more sensitive.
questions.explanation: Structure question 13 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: _____ primarily from plant oils, perfumes were used in ancient times as incense in religious rites, in medicines, and later for adornment.
questions.explanation: Structure question 14 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Boise became _____ of the state of Idaho in 1864.
questions.explanation: Structure question 15 - focuses on grammatical structures and sentence completion.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Soybeans contain a rich concentrations of phytoestrogens, estrogenlike molecules derived from plants.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 16 - the error is in 'concentrations' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: The original Welland Canal, opened which in 1829, was neither deep enough nor wide enough for modern ships.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 17 - the error is in 'opened which' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: A lubricant minimizes the introduction of dirt, moisture, or other foreign materials between sliding surfaces, eliminates wear by keeping the surfaces apart, and prevention corrosion.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 18 - the error is in 'prevention' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: There are thousands of stars in the galaxy that have planets.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 19 - the error is in 'There are' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: The symptoms of pneumonia, a lung infection, include high fever, chest pain, breathing difficult, and coughing.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 20 - the error is in 'breathing difficult' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: A basic premise of humanism is that people are rational beings who possesses the capacity for truth.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 21 - the error is in 'possesses' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: The long of time a battery maintains its useful life while idle depends on many factors.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 22 - the error is in 'long' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Leather is dried under natural or controlled humidity conditions, prepared it for subsequent softening operations.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 23 - the error is in 'prepared it' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Radar can determine the direction, distance, height, and speed of objects that are too much far away for the human eye to see.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 24 - the error is in 'too much' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Establishing outside Minneapolis, Minnesota, in 1976, the Minnesota Valley National Wildlife Refuge contains more than 9,000 acres.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 25 - the error is in 'Establishing' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Most animals have salivary glands what resemble those in humans.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 26 - the error is in 'what' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Used for making pottery, clay has two characteristics distinctive: it can be molded and it can be baked.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 27 - the error is in 'characteristics distinctive' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: The novels of Amy Tan depict of tension between mothers and daughters as well as conflicts experienced by many Chinese immigrants.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 28 - the error is in 'depict of' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: Of all the organized, independent city in Texas, Laredo, founded in 1755, is the oldest.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 29 - the error is in 'city' which should be corrected for proper grammar.

questions.question: Identify the error in: The element potassium makes up less than one half percentage of the human body.
questions.explanation: Written Expression question 30 - the error is in 'one half percentage' which should be corrected for proper grammar.
